name: GET_mc-contacts-exports-id
description:
**This endpoint can be used to check the status of a contact export job**. 

To use this call, you will need the `id` from the "Export Contacts" call.

If you would like to download a list, take the `id` that is returned from the "Export Contacts" endpoint and make an API request here to get the `urls`. Once you have the list of URLs, make a `GET` request on each URL to download your CSV file(s).

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.

$ul: **_metadata**
**count**: The number of items in the entire list, i.e., across all pages.
**next**: The URL of the next page of results. If this field isn't present, you're at the end of the list.
**prev**: The URL of the previous page of results. If this field isn't present, you're at the start of the list.
**self**: The URL of the current page of results.
**completed_at**: The ISO8601 timestamp when the export was completed.
**contact_count**: The total number of exported contacts.
**created_at**: The ISO8601 timestamp when the export was begun.
**expires_at**: The ISO8601 timestamp when the exported file on S3 will expire.
**message**: A human readable message if the status is `failure`.
**status**: The export job's status. Allowed values: `pending`, `ready`, or `failure`.
**updated_at**: The ISO8601 timestamp when the export was updated.
**urls**: One or more download URLs for the contact file if the status is `ready`.
**errors**
**errors**
**errors**
**errors**
**errors**
